description:
NGC 4565; the Needle Galaxy
NGC 4565 also known as the Needle Galaxy is an edge-on spiral galaxy about 40 million light-years away in the constellation Coma Berenices. This image shows it being almost surrounded by hundreds of tiny background galaxies.
Equipment used:
STXL 6303 camera/ FW8G/ AO-X and AT 16RCT telescope with AP 27 TVPH reducer. Astrodon Gen 2 LRGB filter set. AP 1200 mount.
Exposure Times:
Lum = 52 X 10 min, R = 30 X 5 min, G = 36 X 5 min, B = 34 X 5 min. 17 hrs total.
Frames acquired with MaxIm DL 6, calibrated and combined in CCD Stack2. Processed with PixInsight 1.8.
Stardust Ranch, Okeechobee FL

But God made the earth by his power;
he founded the world by his wisdom
and stretched out the heavens by his understanding. (Jeremiah 10:12 NIV)
title: NGC 4565; the Needle Galaxy
